title: Translated Japanese SNES roms
description:
Hey, this is my collection of Japanese SNES roms that have been translated into English. I have done all the necessary patching, so there is no fooling with IPS or UPS files required. I made this because many people have problems figuring out how to patch their roms. Included with the roms are two emulators that I use, ZSNES (the one that I mainly use, because it has extremely low system requirements,) and SNES9x (which I downloaded to play Fire Emblem, which would not play accurately under ZSNES.) There are two versions of SNES9x included, the Windows 32 bit version for XP and up, and the Windows 9x version for Windows ME and Windows 98. I downloaded the patches for these games from http://www.romhacking.net. You can find many more translated games on that site. This torrent only contains the roms that I have in my collection that I play and love.

The roms included are:

Bahamut Lagoon.smc
Chrono Trigger.smc
Der Langrisser.smc
Dragon Quest III.smc
Dual Orb II.smc
Emerald Dragon.smc
Feda - The Emblem of Justice.smc
Final Fantasy IV.smc
Final Fantasy V.smc
Final Fantasy VI.smc
Fire Emblem 3 - Mystery of the Emblem.smc
Front Mission - Gun Hazard.smc
Front Mission.smc
Go Go Ackman.smc
Lennus II - The Apostles of the Seals.smc
Live A Live.smc
Magic Knight Rayearth.smc
Metal Max Returns.smc
Mystic Ark.smc
Robotrek.smc
Star Ocean.smc
Super Bomberman 4.smc
Super Bonk 2.smc
Terranigma.smc
The Glory of Heracles.smc
The Legend of the Holy Sword 3.smc
The Magical Land of Wozz.smc
Treasure of the Rudras.smc

Yes, I know there have been commercial English versions for Chrono Trigger and Final Fantasy VI. These are more accurate versions and the Final Fantasy VI rom has a few bug fixes applied to it as well, (although I left in the good old Vanish / X-Zone bug, I like that one.)
